meanings.definition: Consisting of or characterized by spondees.
meanings.sent1: The poem had a spondaic rhythm, with each foot equally stressed.
meanings.sent2: Her spondaic speech pattern made her easy to understand.
meanings.sent3: The spondaic beat of the music made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: His spondaic movements on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The spondaic pattern of the tiles created a harmonious design.

meanings.sent1: In poetry, a spondaic is a metrical foot with two stressed syllables.
meanings.sent2: The word 'heartbeat' is an example of a spondaic.
meanings.sent3: The spondaic was the highlight of the verse, emphasizing the emotion.
meanings.sent4: The spondaic in the song's chorus added power to the lyrics.
meanings.sent5: The author used a spondaic to create impact in the opening line.
